docs.snippet: With seats and lineup holes to fill, the Mets continue to practice fiscal restraint after five straight losing seasons, leaving fans frustrated....
docs.lead_paragraph: With seats and lineup holes to fill, the Mets continue to practice fiscal restraint after five straight losing seasons, leaving fans frustrated.
docs.abstract: New York Mets continue to practice fiscal restraint after five straight losing seasons, leaving fans frustrated; 2014 payroll, short of $90 million, is not much different from previous year, yet team is approaching 2014 with significant holes in its lineup that could have been addressed through free-agent acquisitions that might have improved chance to contend for playoff spot.

headline.main: Looking Adrift at Citi Field, Mets Keep Their Wallet Closed

byline.original: By RICHARD SANDOMIR and KEN BELSON

docs.snippet: The new tool will include videos and reports that will be updated daily and pushed out to the players’ iPads....
docs.lead_paragraph: The new tool will include videos and reports that will be updated daily and pushed out to the players’ iPads.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees develop new internal app that will make all the club’s scouting material, including videos and written reports, readily available through players’ iPads; manager Joe Girardi say app was developed as tool to better communicate with players and to allow them access to information from nearly anywhere, including an individualized look at their past performances against specific opponents.

headline.main: Yankees Create App for Scouting Reports
headline.print_headline: Yankees Create App for Scouting Reports
